alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 07 at 6:41PM EDT until September 08 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, High risk of rip currents and rough nearshore surf. For the Coastal Flood Statement, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...In Maryland, the Maryland Beaches including Ocean City and Assateague. In Virginia, Accomack County. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Thursday evening. For the Coastal Flood Statement, until 10 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...For the Beach Hazards Statement, breaking waves of 4 to 6 ft will result in rough surf conditions and a high risk of rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Statement, shallow flooding is possible in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
